Description: Neck of East Greek painted pottery neck-amphora. Clay slightly coarse and micaceous, and fired light brown; no slip; paint medium brown and matt. The lip is flanged to receive a cap or lid. Edge of lip, rough bars. Neck, cable. Neck: painted plaited band with a circle and a dotin each "eye". Black dots line the edge of the plaited band.
Curator's comments: The fabric and cable are familiar in the Late Wild Goat Style, but the lip is exceptional. NA analysis by Hans Mommsen (Bonn) attributes the piece to Clazomenae (chemical group E).
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 605, 7)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 6)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 98)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.57 fig.8, Table 1)
